definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to lift/to raise in height/to begin/upsurge/to set off (a campaign)
to stir/to lift/to set sth in motion
to raise a storm/to stir up trouble/to instigate

sentences.english: The shock threw him sideways off the boat.
sentences.chinese: 冲击力把他从船边掀入海里。

sentences.english: They do their utmost to open up power.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在尽最大全力以掀支出开支路。

sentences.english: The horse suddenly tipped its rider off.
sentences.chinese: 马突然将骑马人掀了下来。

sentences.english: Don't scald your hands when you open the steamer.
sentences.chinese: 掀笼屉时小心热气嘘着手。

sentences.english: The carpets had to be taken up when the house was rewired.
sentences.chinese: 这房子重新安装电线时，把地毯都掀了起来。

sentences.english: The front and rear tracks have been increased by 59 mm compared to the hatchback.
sentences.chinese: 前后轮距也分别增加了59毫米，相较于掀背车。

sentences.english: She was unhorsed while riding in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 她在花园骑马时被马从马背上掀了下来。

sentences.english: I think that all we need is this small compact hatchback .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我们只需要这台小型掀背车。

sentences.english: You don't hear us complaining about you leaving it down.
sentences.chinese: 你难道从来没听过我们对你们没掀马桶盖的抱怨吗？

sentences.english: Eat a peach cut not peeled another north-south netizens slobber war.
sentences.chinese: 吃桃子削不削皮再掀南北网友口水战。

sentences.english: The highly unusual action is not unlike that of a toilet seat.
sentences.chinese: 这种非常罕见的动作如同掀马桶盖那样。

sentences.english: And the winds of the north, and the forests of oak and pine.
sentences.chinese: 北风随后吹舞，橡木松林啊掀灵犀。

sentences.english: He gave much to Socrates suddenly lift into the water.
sentences.chinese: 他顾不得许多，猛地把苏格拉底掀下水。

sentences.english: Also a new (LE) hatchback trim package was added that included leather interior.
sentences.chinese: 此外，还在掀背款中增加了真皮内饰的限量版。

sentences.english: The rear opens like a hatchback for luggage.
sentences.chinese: 汽车的后备箱却像两厢车一样是掀背式的。

definition: to lift/to raise in height/to begin/upsurge/to set off (a campaign)
to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
to roll up/to curl up/(of dust etc) to swirl up
variant of 捲起|卷起[juan3 qi3]
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
to take the lid off/to expose/to unmask
to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry
to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
to raise/to lift up (curtains, clothing etc)
billows/great waves (fig. of a story with great momentum)
to pull/to tear/(of cloth, thread etc) to buy/to chat/to gossip/(coll.) (Tw) ridiculous/hokey
